results.title: Like you, like me: see what I feel
results.creator_credit: Alan P. Sloan and Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation
results.brief_description: An animated film which dramatises how a child copes with blindness. Designed to encourage discussion of attitudes toward the blind and to show that a blind or visually impaired child can do many things that other children do.

results.title: Like water for chocolate = Como agua para chocolate
results.creator_credit: Alfonso Arau and Arau Films International
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning Mexican film which tells the story of Tita who is forbidden by tradition and a tyrannical mother to marry Pedro. Tita finds solace for her suppressed passion and sorrow in her cooking, which has a profound effect on all who partake. Based on Laura Esquivel’s best-seller, “Like water for chocolate” is an enchanting film which radiates warmth and emotional depth. It is visual feast starring Marco Leonardi, Lumi Cavazos and Regina Torne. Spanish dialogue. English subtitles.

results.title: Like two mountaineers: the development of Cubism
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Using examples from the Modern Masters exhibition, this film traces the early influences of Suerat, Cezanne and African art on the development of Cubism. Paintings of Picasso and Braque are shown in great detail from the period when they worked “like two mounaineers roped together”. No commentary, music soundtrack only. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Like they used to
results.brief_description: A short story about a Kensington cobbler’s shop that sends a message about our increasingly disposable consumer culture. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.

results.title: Like rings on water
results.brief_description: Discusses the problems of traffic congestion in large cities, and advocates a theory of town planning with effective decentralisation. Suggests a complex of small centres around a larger focal point. Although people naturally gravitate to cities most of their activities could be just as well performed in a more rural setting which could also allow for more freedom, individualism and fresh air.

results.title: Like other people
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrison, Irving Teitelbaum and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: This film depicts many aspects of the lives of handicapped adults living in a residential home run by the Spastic Society. It centres on the lives of Willie and Margaret, and shows their desire for as normal a life as possible. Highlights the need to carefully consider how society treats disabled people. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Like ordinary children
results.brief_description: Focuses on a school in Kent which is for handicapped children. This film is seen through the eyes of the handicapped children themselves, in particular, those with spinal injuries. Also describes the opinions of the older children from the senior school towards the handicapped children. Colorful and informative.

results.title: Like nowhere else
results.brief_description: Like nowhere else graphically summarises some of the changes that have taken place in the Australian landscape since European settlement. We see environmental destruction resulting from the “develop at any cost” mentality that has shaped human relationships with the environment in this country for so long. We also see hope for the future in the growing community concern and the response of governments and industry. Narrated by Robyn Williams with music by Gondwanaland.
